list_definition.definition: (a piece of) cloth for binding up a wound, or a broken bone

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She had a bandage on her injured finger.
The doctor bandaged the boy’s foot.

list_ex_of_english: Is it proposed to tax bandages and other first-aid appliances?
What would the residual liabilities on, for example, the sale of bandages be?
We heard the other day about one hospital where staff are washing bandages by hand and re-using them to effect economies.
Is it really enough to send blankets and bandages after facilitating the supply of arms that caused the injuries in the first place?
She had been taken into hospital within weeks for an easy operation and, after an overnight stay, she had been bandaged up and discharged.
What with the grand alliance, and curing inflation by taxing it, these political streakers will soon be suggesting knee bandages as a cure for cancer.
I was passing a big hospital in my division and saw a little boy coming out with his leg bandaged up.
I took the penicillin bandages only as a case in point.
